newsitem.title: UK: EMI sees $35 mln benefits from U.S. revamp.
newsitem.headline: EMI sees $35 mln benefits from U.S. revamp.

text.p: British music company EMI group plc said on Friday it expected benefits of $35 million in the current financial year from revamp of its U.S. operations with more benefits expected in years to come.
"We anticipate a benefit this year of $35 million out of that investment," chairman Colin Southgate told the annual meeting of shareholders on Friday.
Southgate said the company's U.S. market share had recovered to 13 percent from 10 percent so far in the current financial year.
"We are number three in the world, to be number one we will have to crack the U.S. market".
EMI took a one-off charge of 117.2 million stg last year to cover the cost of revamping its North American operations.
North America accounts for around EMI's annual turnover.
